attributes.action: reject proposals to build up to 300 new homes on Hayling Island in Hampshire
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Havant BC SHLAA has identified green land on Hayling Island as suitable for 300 new houses.

Hayling Island does not have the necessary infrastructure to sustain this development and there are no plans to improve the infrastructure.  The road network cannot cope with the increased traffic from 300 extra dwelings.  300 houses = 300 families at 2.4 children per family.  This is over 600 extra children and a requirement for an entire new school.  There are no plans to improve the road system on Hayling and no plans for any new schools.  

The three main sites for development of houses on Hayling are on green land.  The loss of green land with no consideration for alternative brown field sites elsewhere is unacceptable.

The access road adjacent to Rook Farm Way is particularly unsuitable.  The road is private and designed for light domestic use for 14 houses.  It is not suitable for 64 houses or heavy construction traffic.

The proposed development is unsafe, posing unacceptable risks to families with young children and babies on adjoining sites whose only access to their homes would also be that used by heavy construction plant.

Construction on this scale on Hayling Island should not proceed.
